Detailed Description

Simple document streamer.

Author:
Marc Parizeau, Laboratoire de vision et systèmes numériques, Université Laval

This class is for streaming XML markup with automatic indentation. To add a new markup tag, use method Streamer::openTag, followed by calls to Streamer::insertAttribute to add attributes. Then call again Streamer::openTag to insert any embedded markup. Don't forget to close each tag by calling Streamer::closeTag or Streamer::closeAll.

Here is a simple usage example: 

        Streamer lStream(cout);
        lStream.insertHeader();
        lStream.openTag("MyTag");
        lStream.insertAttribute("name", "value");
        lStream.openTag("MySubTag1");
        lStream.insertAttribute("x", 10);
        lStream.insertAttribute("y", 20);
        lStream.closeTag();
        lStream.openTag("MySubTag2", false);
        lStream.insertStringContent("this is my sub-tag number 2!");
        lStream.closeTag();
        lStream.closeTag();

which will produce the following result: 

        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
        <MyTag name="value">
        <MySubTag1 x="10" y="20"/>
        <MySubTag2>this is my sub-tag number 2!</MySubTag2>
        </MyTag>

string & XML::Streamer::convertToQuotes ( string &  ioString,
const char *  inQuotes = "<>&'\"" 
) [static]

Convert special xml characters to quotes.

Returns:
A reference to the converted string.

Supported characters are &, < >, ', ".

void PACC::XML::Streamer::insertAttribute ( const string &  inName,
Type  inValue 
) [inline]

Insert a template attribute with name inName and value inValue into the current start tag.

This method assumes that typename Type knows how to insert itself into a stream using operator<<.

template<typename Container >
void PACC::XML::Streamer::insertContainer ( const Container &  inObject,
const string &  inName = "" 
) [inline]

Insert STL container inObject into this streamer, using tag name inName.

If no tag name is specified, the container's content is inserted into the current tag. Assumes that the container's elements can insert themselves into a streamer using operator<<.

void XML::Streamer::insertHeader ( const string &  inEncoding = "ISO-8859-1"  ) 

Insert a valid xml declarative tag with encoding inEncoding (default is ISO-8859-1).

The header tag has the form <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>.

template<typename Type >
void PACC::XML::Streamer::insertPrimitiveTag ( Type  inValue,
const string &  inTagName,
const string &  inAttName = "v" 
) [inline]

Insert a primitive tag with tag name inTagName, attribute name inAttName, and value inValue.

The format for this primitive tag is <inTagName inAttName="inValue"/>. This method assumes that typename Type knows how to insert itself into a stream using operator<<.

void XML::Streamer::insertStringContent ( const string &  inString,
bool  inConvert = true 
)

Insert string inString as content of current markup.

By default, any occurence of characters '&' and '<' will be automatically converted to quotes "&amp;" and "&lt;". If argument inConvert is set to false, this conversion is disabled.

void XML::Streamer::openTag ( const string &  inName,
bool  inIndent = true 
)

Open new markup tag using name inName.

By default, markup tags are indented by the number of columns specified in the class constructor. However, argument inIndent can be set to false to disactivate indentation for all embedded markup.
